intro: Syngonanthus densiflorus var. densiflorus, commonly known as the dense-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually clustered in dense clusters along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, giving it its common name. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that are typically red or yellow, attracting birds that help in seed dispersal. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions where it forms a symbiotic relationship with its host trees.
